means: [女子名] [英格兰人姓氏] 佩欣丝绰号，来源于中世纪英语、古法语，含义是“忍耐”(patience) 昵称Patty

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均含"忍耐，耐心"之意。
means: patience ： 普通用词，通常指不急不躁的容忍态度或能力。
endurance ： 侧重指忍受艰辛或痛苦的能力。

sentence.Network_en: Non-violence and patience are the central tenets of their faith.
sentence.Network_cn: 非暴力和忍耐是他们的信仰的核心原则。

sentence.Network_en: Her husband was sympathetic at first but his patience soon wore thin.
sentence.Network_cn: 一开始她丈夫还抱以同情，可不久就失去耐心了。

sentence.Network_en: It was exacting work and required all his patience.
sentence.Network_cn: 工作很艰巨，需要他有极大的耐心。

克里表示，美国的对北韩政策不是“战略忍耐 (strategic patience) ”，而是“战略不忍耐 (strategic impatience) ”。同时就与北韩谈判重申.

jx.jx_en_mean: become unable to keep one's temper

lj.lj_ly: even Laurence finally &B{lost patience with} him.
lj.lj_ls: 即使是劳伦斯最后也对他发了脾气。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, from Latin patientia, from patient- 'suffering', from the verb pati

entry.def: If you have patience, you are able to stay calm and not get annoyed, for example when something takes a long time, or when someone is not doing what you want them to do.

example.ex: He doesn't have the patience to wait...
It was exacting work and required all his patience.
example.tran: 工作很艰巨，需要他有极大的耐心。

entry.def: Patience is a card game for only one player.

example.ex: He would often sit and play patience.
example.tran: 他常常坐着玩单人纸牌游戏。

entry.tran: 考验…的耐心；使忍无可忍
entry.def: If someone tries your patience or tests your patience, they annoy you so much that it is very difficult for you to stay calm.

example.ex: He tended to stutter, which tried her patience...
example.tran: 他老结巴，这叫她难以忍受。

example.ex: I feel that she would try the patience of a saint.
example.tran: 我觉得圣人都能被她逼疯。

means.word_mean: 1. good-natured tolerance of delay or incompetence
2. a card game played by one person

auth_sentence.content: The second half was all about composure and patience.
auth_sentence.res_content: The second half was all about composure and patience.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The second half was all about composure and patience.

auth_sentence.content: That will be a challenge that could require patience.
auth_sentence.res_content: That will be a challenge that could require patience.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That will be a challenge that could require patience.

auth_sentence.content: We do not have any patience for red tape.
auth_sentence.res_content: We do not have any patience for red tape.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We do not have any patience for red tape.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =feeling,表示"感情"; 2. = 表示"忍耐,遭受"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 能和睦相处的,合得来的;兼容的
stems_affixes.word_buile: com共同+pati感情+ible……的→有共同感情→能相处的
im无+patient[n.病人,患者 adj.忍耐的,耐心的]→adj.不耐烦的,急躁的
pati忍耐+ent……的→忍耐的→[病人,患者]必须忍受痛苦
compatib=compatible[adj.能和睦相处的,合得来的;兼容的]+ility→compatible名词
pati忍耐+ent……的→忍耐的→[病人,患者]必须忍受痛苦

Sentence.sentence: For example, Americans today do not pay much attention to the proverb "Haste makes waste", because patience is not important to them.
It demands physical endurance and patience.
it takes patience for humans to realize their dreams
For example, Americans today do not pay much attention to the proverb "Haste makes waste", because patience is not important to them.

means.word_mean: 耐性, 忍耐力, 耐心

sentences.en: We haven't the patience to hear such an empty talk.
sentences.cn: 我们可没耐心去听这种空谈。

jushi.english: We haven't the patience to hear such an empty talk.
jushi.chinese: 我们可没耐心去听这种空谈。

jushi.english: I wouldn't have the patience to sit mending watches all day.
jushi.chinese: 我可没有整天坐着修理钟表的耐性。

jushi.english: The teacher had no patience with the less intelligent pupils.
jushi.chinese: 那位老师对不太聪明的学生没有耐性。
